ValueElement.Label: Purpose
ValueElement.Value: Detection and quantification of pneumothorax on chest radiograph (CXR)

KeyValue.Label: Value Proposition
KeyValue.Value: Pneumothorax can be a potentially life-threatening, readily treated emergency. AI meeting this use case would help in detecting, quantitating, comparing, and alerting both non-specialists and radiologists to this potentially life-threatening abnormality. In clinical settings where a radiologist is not readily available, such detection would be of value to non-radiologists. In clinical settings where radiologists are available, such detection could be used to alert the radiologist and prioritize its reporting and notification to the treating physicians. One possible extension to this use case is to track changes in size of previously detected pneumothorax and those undertreatment.

KeyValue.Label: Narrative(s)
KeyValue.Value: 25 year old presents after a motor vehicle accident, and a CXR is taken in the emergency room. Algorithm evaluates image and categorizes the chest as being normal, abnormal or undetermined. If a radiologist is not present at the time of imaging, an alert is provided to the ordering physician. If a radiologist is present, the exam is prioritized in the radiologist worklist for urgent interpretation and reporting. A 70 year old admitted to ICU has several physiologic and monitoring interventions that have a risk of pneumothorax as a complication. Algorithm evaluates image and categorizes the chest as being normal, abnormal or undetermined. If a radiologist is not present at the time of imaging, an alert is provided to the ordering physician. If a radiologist is present, the exam is prioritized in the radiologist worklist for urgent interpretation and reporting.

ValueElement.Label: Chest Trauma
ValueElement.Value: chest wall injury, rib fracture, lung contusions, lacerations, pleural fluid

ValueElement.Label: Comorbidity
ValueElement.Value: pleural fluid (including air/fluid levels}, lung disease (bullous emphysema, bronchiectasis, etc.), pneumomediastinum, other extrapleural air collections

ValueElement.Label: Chest Tube
ValueElement.Value: Without tubes, With one or more chest tubes/drainage catheters, interval placement, or removal of tubes

KeyValue.Label: Clinical Workflow
KeyValue.Value: Image obtained from modality and sent to PACS and the AI engine. Image analyzed by engine. System detects and quantitates the pneumothorax. An alert message is sent to PACS from the engine with the information, and identification, and graphic highlighting the pneumothorax.

ValueElement.Label: Extensions
ValueElement.Value: Describe additional features that might enhance the value of this application in the clinical environment. This could be elements that would help clinicians verify the output or related applications that might ingest the output of this use case.

ValueElement.Label: Size Comparison
ValueElement.Value: Algorithm compares prior imaging and returns differences in output elements (pneumothorax detection, pleural separation, and pneumothorax volume)

ValueElement.Label: Synonym
ValueElement.Value: Panel members involved with review and additional support to publish the use case

NumericDataElement.Label: Pneumothorax volume
NumericDataElement.Hint: Measure volume of pneumothorax as a function of interpleural distance
